discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
BFD is enabled by default on all vEdge routers and we cannot disable it. For SDWAN, BFD is used to detect path liveliness (up/down) and measure quality (loss/latency/jitter/IPSec tunnel MTU).

https://www.certprepare.com/bi-directional-forwarding-detection-bfd-tutorial#:~:text=For%20SDWAN%2C%20BFD%20is%20used,jitter%2FIPSec%20tunnel%20MTU).

questions.question_text: Which protocol detects path status (up/down), measures loss/latency/jitter, and measures the quality of the IPsec tunnel MTU?

choices.D: Delete and re-add vSmart. Click Generate and validate CSR.
choices.A: Reconfigure the vSmart from CLI with the proper Hostname & System IP.
choices.E: Request a certificate from the certificate server based on the CSR for the vSmart.
choices.C: Install the certificate received from the certificate server.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. vManage and vBond have an issue establishing a connection to vSmart. Which two actions does the administrator take to fix the issue? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Ans should be A

sla-class sla-class-name preferred-color colorsâ€”To set multiple tunnels to use when data traffic matches an SLA class, include the preferred-color option, specifying two or more tunnel colors. Traffic is load-balanced across all tunnels. If no tunnel matches the SLA, data traffic is sent through any available tunnel. In this sense, color preference is considered to be a loose matching, not a strict matching, because data traffic is always forwarded, whether a tunnel of the preferred color is available or not. When no tunnel matches the SLA, you can choose how to handle the data traffic:

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/command/sdwan-cr-book/config-cmd.html#r_sla_class_3907.xml

search for preferred-color

Option [A]
sla-class sla-[class-name] preferred-color mpls biz-internet
The above command sets both WAN tunnels to be load balanced. 

Link Reference:-
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/policies/vedge-20-x/policies-book/application-aware-routing.html

Selected Answer: A
A is correct for sure.

Selected Answer: A
preferred color color1 color2 if both are meeting the SLA traffic is Load balanced between the two.

questions.question_text: An enterprise deployed a Cisco SD-WAN solution with hub-and-spoke topology using MPLS as the preferred network over the Internet. A network engineer must implement an application-aware routing policy to allow ICMP traffic to be load-balanced over both the available links. Which configuration meets the requirement?

discussion.content:
The correct answer is [B]

You are not able to include both the strict option and backup-sla-preferred-color.
The strict option drops traffic immediately when the preferred-color tunnel is no longer available.

The backup-sla-preferred-color {color} allows traffic to be forwarded to a secondary WAN tunnel.

Cisco white paper Link:-
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/routers/sdwan/configuration/policies/vedge-20-x/policies-book/application-aware-routing.html

Selected Answer: B
I am quite agree with the volks.

Selected Answer: B
B, the only that meet the requirements

Yes, B. 
A is strict
B is public > private , not strict (correct)
C is public > public
D is private > public

choices.C: Configure a default route on vBond pointing to 172.16.2.254.
choices.B: Configure the encapsulation ipsec command under the tunnel interface on vManage.
choices.D: Remove the encapsulation ipsec command under the tunnel interface of vBond.
